text:
The Kahala Hotel & Resort Appoints Bill Hinkley as Director of Security
The Kahala Hotel & Resort, Hawai‘i’s premier oasis of luxury and elegance, today announced the appointment of Bill Hinkley as director of security. He is responsible for the development and implementation of comprehensive security, safety and emergency preparedness policies and programs to safeguard the 338-room luxury resort along with its guests and employees.
“Bill’s extensive background and expertise are well suited to our resort in ensuring the safety and security of our business, associates and guests,” said Carmine Iommazzo, general manager of The Kahala Hotel & Resort.
Hinkley has three decades of experience in security operations at world-renown hotels, resorts and casinos, along with eight years of experience as a police officer at various counties in New Jersey. Prior to joining The Kahala Hotel & Resort, he held a number of key security leadership positions at Grand Sierra Resort in Reno; Thunder Valley Casino in Lincoln, Calif.; Soboba Casino in San Jacinto, Calif.; and Palms Casino Resort, Imperial Palace Hotel & Casino, Bellagio Hotel & Casino, Treasure Island Hotel & Casino and The Mirage Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas.
A native of New Jersey, Hinkley attended County College of Morris and graduated from the New Jersey State Police Academy in its 170th Municipal Class.
Source:- Kahala Hotel & Resort
